intro: Xanthoselinum alsaticum, commonly known as the Alpine sweet rocket, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central and Eastern Europe. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants, and is characterized by its small, showy flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. The plant has a compact growth habit, with hairy leaves and a short, upright stem. It thrives in well-drained, rocky soils and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky slopes at high elevations. Xanthoselinum alsaticum is a perennial species that blooms from late spring to early summer.
